text.p: Mark Ramprakash has been recalled by England for the the final Ashes test against Australia beginning at The Oval on Thursday.
The 27-year-old Middlesex captain replaces Lancashire's John Crawley for the sixth test, Australia having already retained the Ashes.
Ramprakash has not played for England for almost two years but the selectors turned to him again on Sunday following his fine championship form over the summer.
He has scored just 533 runs at an average if 16.65 in 19 tests but is still rated one of the biggest talents in the English game.
Pace bowler Darren Gough failed to convince the selectors that he would have recovered in time from the knee injury which he aggravated in the fourth test at Headingley.
Surrey opener Mark Butcher has also been recalled after missing just one test and Lancashire seamer Peter Martin makes the squad as cover for Dean Headley who has a bruised heel.

Mike Atherton (Captain), Mark Butcher, Andrew Caddick, Robert Croft, Dean Headley, Ben Hollioake, Adam Hollioake, Nasser Hussain, Devon Malcolm, Peter Martin, Mark Ramprakash, Alec Stewart, Graham Thorpe, Phil Tufnell.
